      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawMaze()
      Generates a random number of walls that is less than 1/3 the amount of the available spaces Randomly places the walls and then generates numbers 1-100 for the remaining spaces
      int getNumCols()
      Returns the local value of the number of columns
      int getNumRows()
      Returns the local value of the number of rows
      boolean isSolvable()
      Calls the recursive solution, prints out the result, and number of coins picked up on the path
      void printMaze()
      Prints out the stored maze with the walls and coins available
      void printResult()
      Prints the path that is found with walls and coins if the space is not in the path.

      Sets local number of columns with param

        public void drawMaze()

      • isSolvable

        public boolean isSolvable()
        Calls the recursive solution, prints out the result, and number of coins picked up on the path
        Returns:
        solved Whether or not a path was found

      • solveMazeRecursively

        private boolean solveMazeRecursively(int row,
                                     int col)
        Recursively solves the maze. Checks for all four directions of movement Changes the visited array if a position is valid for the path to the destination
        Parameters:
        row - Number of rows in the maze
        col - Number of columns in the maze
        Returns:
        True or False depending on if a path is found

      • printResult

        public void printResult()
        Prints the path that is found with walls and coins if the space is not in the path. + is printed for the path.
